Design.Name: Submitted Code before Design
Design.Desc: Make sure to do your design first, before writing any code, as it will greatly assist you in your implementation. No design in first submission

Design.Name: Incorrect UML Style
Design.Desc: Make sure to follow UML style guides in your diagram

Design.Name: Short descriptions
Design.Desc: Expand more on your descriptions of core functions, as it will assist in your implementation

Design.Name: No test case reason
Design.Desc: Each test case should include a comment as to what it is testing

Design.Name: Needs more test cases
Design.Desc: A broader range of test cases are required to try and cover potential edge cases or “program breaking” scenarios

Design.Name: Minimal or no test cases
Design.Desc: Test cases should include multiple example inputs, expected outputs, and a comment on what it is testing

Design.Name: Code in design
Design.Desc: Do not include any code in your design, as you should be designing before you are coding

Style.Name: Using `using namespace std`
Style.Desc: Do not include `using namespace std;` in your header files, as it pollutes the namespace and encourages bad design (-0.5).

Style.name: Redunant comments
Style.Desc: Keep your comments relevant and concise, and aim to explain WHY you are doing something, not WHAT you are doing.

Style.Name: Verbose comments
Style.Desc: Overly verbose comments, try to keep them concise and relevant

Style.Name: Minimal comments
Style.Desc: Minimal or no comments throughout code

Style.Name: Dead code
Style.Desc: Avoid including commented out code in your final submission

Other.Name: junk files
Other.Desc: Please avoid submitting other files or binaries (eg, a.out) to SVN, as it is bad practice and will fill up your SVN storage
